titleStmt.title: A booke of proclamtions, published since the beginning of his Maiesties most happy reigne ouer England, &c. Vntill this present moneth of Febr. 3. Anno Dom. 1609
Proclamations
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1603-1625 : James I)
James I, King of England, 1566-1625.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Robert Barker, printer to the Kings most excellent Maiestie,

notesStmt.note: The year dates are according to Lady Day dating.

The format of this collection raised suspicions in Commons because it embodied proclamations "in such form as acts of parliament formerly have been, and still are used to be" printed. Nevertheless, the collection facilitated page reference to the content of proclamations judged particularly grievous, items which were essentially voided in STC 8451--STC.
At foot of title page: Cum priuilegio.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
